title: Fundamental Theorem with derivative of integral

content.question: Let h be the function defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mrow> <mi>π</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>4</mn> </mrow> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle><mi>t</mi><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@49C3@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Which of the following is an equation for the line tangent to the graph of h at the point where <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac> <mi>π</mi> <mn>4</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AE0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?

topic.text: 6.4: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Accumulation Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
